title: Lowest CO2 Emissions from Energy Fugitive Emissions
description: In 2023, Ethiopia recorded one of the lowest CO2 emissions from energy fugitive emissions, with a value of just 0.0001 Mt CO2e.

title: Lowest Urban Population in Large Cities
description: As of 2024, only 4.32% of Ethiopia's population lived in urban agglomerations of more than 1 million people, one of the lowest percentages globally.

title: Longest Lead Time to Export
description: In 2018, Ethiopia had one of the longest lead times to export, with a median of 60 days.

title: Lowest Female Doctoral Educational Attainment
description: In 2021, only 0.0065% of Ethiopian women aged 25 and older had attained a doctoral or equivalent level of education, one of the lowest rates worldwide.

title: Highest Expenditure on Tertiary Education
description: In 2015, Ethiopia allocated 47.85% of its government education expenditure to tertiary education, one of the highest proportions globally.

title: Lowest Access to Basic Sanitation
description: In 2022, only 9.34% of Ethiopia's population had access to at least basic sanitation services, one of the lowest access rates in the world.

title: Lowest Percentage of Employers in Employment
description: In 2023, only 0.13% of Ethiopia's total employment consisted of employers, one of the lowest percentages globally.

title: Lowest Completeness of Birth Registration
description: In 2016, only 2.7% of births in Ethiopia were registered, one of the lowest completeness rates worldwide.
